B: Friends of Free Enterprise In Canada
Text: Adam Waterous backed Pierre Poilievre in the 2025 election, signing on to an ad campaign called Friends of Free Enterprise in Canada.
Adam Waterous donated to Pierre Poilievre in the 2025 election.
Adam Waterous is the CEO and managing partner of Waterous Energy.
Birchcliff's CEO serves on the CAPP board.
The Canada Strong and Free Network (formerly the Manning Centre) is partnered with the Atlas Network and has been listed as a member on Atlas' website.
The Canada Strong and Free Network has been a significant backer of Canada Strong and Proud/Proud to Be a Canadian, donating $240,500 in 2023.
The Canada Strong and Free Network funded and platformed pro-Pierre Poilievre voices and organizations.
The goal of Canada Strong and Proud's network was to vilify the Liberals in support of Pierre Poilievre and the Conservative party in the 2025 election.
The Canadian Consitution Foundation is a member of the Atlas Network.
The Canadian Constititution Foundation is listed as a partner on the Canada Strong and Free Network website.
CAPP is listed as a partner on the Canada Strong and Free Network website.
Cenovus sponsored the Canada Strong and Free Network's 2025 conference.
Cenovus' CEO serves as chair of the CAPP board of directors.
Cenovus is a member of Pathways Alliance.
Charles Koch's foundations have donated to the Atlas Network since 1987.
Koch Industries is listed as a partner on the Canada Strong and Free Network website, and has funded their conferences.
The Fraser Institute was supported by the Charles Koch Institute in 2024 and 2023.
The Fraser Institute is a member of the Atlas Network.

A: Friends of Free Enterprise In Canada
Text: Friends of Free Enterprise Canada paid for ads supporting Pierre Poilivere in major Canadian newspapers.
The Frontier Centre for Public Policy is a member of the Atlas Network.
The Frontier Centre is listed as a partner on the Canada Strong and Free Network website.
Gwyn Morgan was a member of the Canada Strong and Free Network (previously known as the Manning Centre) as recently as 2019.
Gwyn Morgan was on the board of directors at the Fraser Institute as recently as 2023.

B: Friends of Free Enterprise In Canada
Text: Gwyn Morgan backed Pierre Poilievre in the 2025 election, signing on to an ad campaign called Friends of Free Enterprise in Canada.
Gwyn Morgan has written for the Globe and Mail.
Gwyn Morgan is regular contributor to the National Post.
Gwyn Morgan was the founding CEO of the Canadian oil company Encana, which later became Ovintiv after moving to the United States.
Gwyn Morgan has donated to Pierre Polievre and the Conservative Party.
The Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation has donated millions to the Canada Strong and Free Network and is listed as a partner on CSFN's website.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $100,000 CAD to the Canadian Constititution Foundation.
The Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation has donated $1,500,000 to the Fraser Institute.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $50,000 CAD to the Frontier Centre for Public Policy.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $50,000 CAD to the Institute for Liberal Studies.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $75,000 CAD to the Justice Centre for Constitutional Freedom.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $50,000 CAD to the Montreal Economic Institute.
In 2024, the Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation gave $200,000 CAD to Second Street.

The Gwyn Morgan and Patricia Trottier Foundation donated $300,000 to True North, who covered the 2025 campaign without naming Morgan, a possible violation of charitable laws that prohibit direct partisan activity.
Imperial Oil sponsored the Canada Strong and Free Network's 2025 conference.
Imperial Oil's CEO serves on the CAPP board.
The Fraser Institute has received regular donations from Imperial Oil's parent company ExxonMobil.
Imperial Oil has donated regularly to the Macdonald Laurier Institute.
Imperial Oil is a member of Pathways Alliance.
The Institute for Liberal Studies is a member of the Atlas Network.
The Institute for Liberal Studies is listed as a partner on the Canada Strong and Free Network website.
Canada Proud's Jeff Ballingall provided the inspiration for and worked with Canada Strong and Proud.
Pierre Poilievre's Conservative party leadership campaign hired Jeff Ballingall's company, Mobilize Media Group, to "boost his message online” in 2022.
Jeff Tonken is the Chairman of Birchcliff Energy.

Michael Binnion donated to the Conservative Party of Canada with Pierre Poilievre as leader.
